Context:
* Counselling is a conversation with a professional counsellor in a safe, private environment to discuss concerns and problems.
* Counselling groups are counsellor-facilitated opportunities for students to connect with others, learn coping strategies faster than individual therapy, instil hope, and provide useful information/skills.
* All information told to the counsellor is strictly confidential and will not be shared with anyone without written permission, except in rare occasions as stated in their privacy policy.
* Most issues related to personal and academic concerns are addressed through counselling services.
* Currently registered students at George Brown College are eligible to receive counselling services at no cost.
* Sessions can be up to 60 minutes long depending on the issues discussed.
* Accommodations for special needs can be facilitated by indicating on the online intake form or contacting letstalk@georgebrown.ca, letstalkcl@georgebrown.ca, letstalkwf@georgebrown.ca.
* To book/cancel appointments, use the Student Portal.
* Contact letstalk@georgebrown.ca, letstalkcl@georgebrown.ca, letstalkwf@georgebrown.ca for assistance or questions.
